remarks: A kernel is a hyperplane iff it doesn't contain all vectors. (Contributed by NM, 1-Nov-2014.)
statement:
lkrshp4.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lkrshp4.h $e |- H = ( LSHyp ` W ) $.
lkrshp4.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` W ) $.
lkrshp4.k $e |- K = ( LKer ` W ) $.
lkrshp4.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lkrshp4.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
lkrshp4 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( K ` G ) =/= V <-> ( K ` G ) e. H ) ) $.
